name: places/ChIJkeVO3rxZwokRdRiL-xpjG78
adrFormatAddress: 1870 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA

editorialSummary.text: Chain retailer offering a huge selection of modern furniture, home accessories & kitchen items.

originalText.text:
No customer service here.

I have shopped at west elm in Hoboken and decided to give this Manhattan branch a try, it was very disappointing. No acknowledgement or help from the staff that work there.

I thought because they have a bigger showroom and more items that their service would reflect that! Big let down

text.text:
No customer service here.

I have shopped at west elm in Hoboken and decided to give this Manhattan branch a try, it was very disappointing. No acknowledgement or help from the staff that work there.

I thought because they have a bigger showroom and more items that their service would reflect that! Big let down

originalText.text:
I am compelled to share my deeply troubling experience with West Elm, a company that has shown an utter disregard for customer satisfaction and quality service. This is not just a tale of delayed deliveries and poor product quality; it’s a glaring example of a company-wide apathy that seems to permeate every level of the organization, right up to the executive leadership.

In November, I ordered a banquet set, expecting delivery by late January. In a display of gross mismanagement, this delivery was postponed to April at the last minute, without any reasonable explanation. When I sought clarity from customer service, my calls were not just ignored but abruptly cut off, a clear sign of disrespect towards customers.

Furthermore, my order of a Leroy couch, due in March, was similarly delayed to April, again with no justification provided. This pattern of unannounced, inexplicable delays suggests a serious lack of organizational integrity and efficiency at West Elm.

Adding insult to injury, the sheets I purchased from them arrived with a hole and poor stitching. Despite reaching out via email to address this issue, my concerns were met with silence. Taking a step further, I emailed the executive leadership team, only to be faced with the same indifference. This lack of response from the highest levels of the company speaks volumes about West Elm’s disregard for customer experience.

This is not just a failure of processes but a complete breakdown of customer-centric values. The CEO and the executive team at West Elm need to recognize this and feel ashamed for allowing such a culture to persist. Your company’s blatant neglect for customer concerns and basic service standards is appalling.

To anyone considering West Elm for their home furnishings, I urge you to reconsider. My experience has been a testament to the company’s indifference towards its customers. You are likely better off with a brand that values and respects its customers.

West Elm, your lack of response and concern is a clear message to your customers that their satisfaction is not your priority. You have lost more than just a customer in me; you have lost your credibility and trust.

originalText.text: The sales people are nice but the delivery and issues I’ve had with this company are over the top. I was told that some items were in stock and now my order was pushed out 4 months. I was told a piece arrived in their warehouse however it was so damaged it couldn’t be delivered. And now they are telling me I was delivered and it wasn’t. Now I’m told I have to wait another 6-8 weeks and my order would not be expedited. The drawers on the end tables I just received don’t close. I’m over West Elm (but not the employees at the store. They were extremely helpful)

They were extremely helpful)

originalText.text: Popped in on a whim today searching for a lamp to purchase on site. From the greeting at the door from the lovely young lady, to the lovely sales lady that helped me upstairs, to the lovely and kind gentlemen that brought the lamp out and rung me up. It was such a pleasant experience. Thank you to the staff here for being so helpful and courteous. You guys are exemplary!

originalText.text: Every time I came into the store, everyone was super nice to me especially Nabs and Shai who helped me out. The delivery people are great as well. My only concern is that the furniture takes a while to get there but that’s really no one’s fault since it is popular. Great people and furniture.
